content.text: The Bridge Ways Cosmology
The cosmology of this world is one of bridges, mist and an endless sea. It extends to all knowledge infinitely side ways and long ways however not vertically. At it’s lowest point is sea of
Morathomear
; the great unending black ocean where all souls come to rest beyond it’s depths only the forgotten dead know. Rising tens or sometimes hundreds of meters above is the lowest point of the
Mirrormear
. Known as the Fade, here the mist and fog from higher falls a condenses into a seething ever storm potentially a kilometre thick. The majority of the
is an open mist filled sky of crisscrossing bridges extending into infinity and going either a few kilometres high or tens of kilometres higher if no plane sits above it.
Finally come the planes, while the
and
and generally considered planes they are more like one infinite transitive places built of layers. The planes sit upon the
and where it is infinite/in size; these are infinite in the diversity, with different kinds of people, physics and magics.
The Planes and their Elements

The planes cut their way through the world and built on the elements of our worlds. Certain elements will cause the powers of these worlds to shrink or grow. As many bright and dark creatures draw on Planar powers to empower themselves. One of these effects, is beings that draw on these powers are vulnerable to these elements.
What does this mean? Improve this
Important
A Change in Conjunctions

These are areas of great magic where many arcane sources meld, their physical appearance can vary massively from great dams that separate the seas to a forest with animalistic instincts. Conjunctions affects the
Mirrormear
like an earthquake and a loud note can be heard around them.
The Growth of the Vetaland Conflict
There is a 12 year proxy war in the Vetalands between rebellion militias funded by
and the local monarch funded by
, while these are the main to groups there are a number of smaller break out sides in certain areas who generally associate under the Lakersiders, who fall in between robinhood and pirates.
The Sun and Moon
In
Athos
’s sky, two major celestial spirits are the sun from
Cassus
and the Moon from
Yalavey
. They are manifestations of themselves and the power they draw upon.
Death
In Kaleah, the spirit
Kerrigan
is the dead’s warden. By his protection souls fall as sand through the
Mirrormear
, rarely with interruption to
Morathomear
Countries
A fey world of colour and magic
Notes
In Alothea, there is no day or night. Only regions and some people of permanent day and permanent night.
The primary language that Alothearan?
The lands of Alothea represent the four seasons that hold sacred tenants to the people of Alothea. They represent their philosophy. These philosophies can be seen in the
Fey Courts
A lands of swampy jungles and arid deserts, populated by low tech Lizardfolk and Horned Aarakocra

A wild hot land of vast deserts and dense jungles, inhabited by great reptilian and avian beasts and humanoids. The land is fairly primitive in terms of technology, politics and the arcane with one exception. The old gods of this land sleep woken only by individuals of great potential, which has left the door open to
Era
, who is known in the land as the White-Eyed Fever.
The land is primarily dominated by the
Diasong Empire
they are a mostly single species xenophobic civilisation with a strong political class and a vast yet primitive industry.
Rules of the Transitive Planes

Transitive planes sits somewhat out of time. Few things changes here and when entering and leaving time can pass strangely. People can travel vast distances seemingly in a blink of an eye to the other worlds.
Creatures can either chose to believe they are limited and affected by normal space. Or they can abuse the powers here and be taken by the cognitive fade…
Advantages
Spells and abilities you enter with can be used without use or slot limits
Damage doesn't hurt or cause injury unless it's massive damage over a third of the creature’s max health.
A creature’s form is frozen, neither decaying or ageing.
Disadvantages
Healing will not regenerate a creature unless it is more than a third of a creature’s max health
Spell Conversion
The time you can spend in the Mirrormear for a standard teleportation spell is equivalent to T
seconds
= d
feet
Standard Teleportation Spells.
They do not function in the Mirrormear (though there are objects that allow reversing them) and in Morathomear these spells require acclimatization.
Sending.
Sending can not travel between the Living realms, it can go along vertical realms
Banishment.
It works by pushing you down ‘vertically’ through the planes, it is one of the best ways to get into the transitive planes. It can push you past Morathomear…
Planar Shift.
This spell requires a item of planar attunement. These are Vistani
Threads
that creatures can use to navigate the planes. Plane Shift causes you to drop down through the Mirrormear and then crashes parts down onto Morathomear and warps space their to expedite your journey.
Gate.
This is an incredibly destructive spell that rips realities together and causes intense spilling of realities together…
Large arcane machines have been used to normalise these effects and solidify them (Edessa)
There are seven (significant) Qarthearn’s spread out through the realms
A desolate world of inky nights and searing day. This is the home plane of the great spirits
Era
and
Aru
. It once had life but no longer…

It used to be a lush planet home to many beings but few spirits. There were the great spirit of the Stars, Era, and the great spirit of the Earth Aru. Aru was known for his craft and spell work and developed a great material, the black marble, that he invested into the earth to let the people of Qarthear create great wonders but Era was jealous and had designs on being greater.

She managed to trick the people of Qarthear to unite and invest all their great works together and secretly allowing her to draw all the power from them, in reward for incredible gifts. Once she had enough she slew Aru leaving the world dead and her light so powerful she petrified the dead ground to the stone that made the world so powerful. All who stayed perished, all except
Anima
who Era saved and left in solitude on the planet…
The Golden Storm
It also is known as the Searing Tempest, Aneradite Anomaly or the Deadman’s Shortcut
The planes surrounding Qarthear like the
Mirrormear
and particularly
Morathomear
are subject to Era’s influence creating great tempests filled with tendrils of permanent radiant lightning that move through space like the ever hunting tendrils of a jellyfish.
Ideas for names of other sectors
Eramian
Soranen
Potentially
The Realm of Cancer...
This is the domain of cruelty, venom and madness.
The true domain of life

It is a veiled word. The path to it being a mystery though it is readily accessible as in every plane a bit of it pushes its way in like a cancer. Confined to small areas depending on the level of influence.
It is possible for sinkholes to the Elsewhere to open up in
Morathomear
sea.
A land of many floating islands above the Mirrormear.
It is fairly knowledgeable about the wider Mirrormear
Era isn't interested in it as with know primary ground it couldn't support Aru
The People
There is only considered one species from Orokia however players can pick any variant of
Tiefling
or
Dragonborn
The Lands

The Mirrormear is the transitive plane of the bridge ways cosmology; it is a plane of mist and great stone bridge that crisscross under and over each other into infinity. There are two levels to the Mirrormear; the lower is called the Fade and is a roiling mass of dark clouds around a kilometre thick. It sublimates at the edge of liquid and gas and is what separates the Mirrormear and the
. The higher level is far taller, anywhere from a few to tens of kilometres tall, and is a more open sky of clouds and criss-crossing bridges as far as the eye can sea.
Fadespawn
of the Mirrormear

These are creatures native to the Mirrormear that are formed out of the Fade. They say these are really what happens when someone slips and falls from the bridges; instead of falling to their death in
they get caught in Fade where it disfigures them and drives them insane.
Settlements are fairly rare in the Mirrormear but they do exist, particularly at cross roads between the planes or in the deep Mirrormear where the sky reach high above you and no plane rests there.
The sea of death and old souls, this is where all those that pass will eventually fall and sink into the beyond.
Beneath the many bridge ways of the

is the Fade where mist condense and fall in titanic cascading rivers of rain into the great sea of Morathomear. Other than a few sporadic islands caused by conjunctions or the death of particularly great souls the plane is uninhabited by the living or natural...
The Great Sea

The Great Sea extends in all directions as far as the Mirrormear reaches, which is by all known accounts infinitely. It is has the appearance of black glass as it is incredibly still, only disturbed by souls passing through; the greater the soul the greater the disturbance.

Interacting with the sea is very dangerous; living will be drained and die almost instantly unless they are very powerful. If you touch it while dead souls, you may stand and walk upon it’s surface for as long as you have any spirit left in you (often this spirit is stored and bartered for with
soul coins

, the de facto currency of the Morathomear). Finally inorganic matter is mostly stopped by the surface sinking only a little depending on how living it could have been where it slowly but violently evaporates unless protect by water.
Travelling the Great Sea
A trip beyond your plane could take months and is very perilous if you where travelling through the Mirrormear by foot. However you can travel by Windrunner through this lovely plane.
In the
time can be very inconsistent, in Morathomear so is space.

Windrunners are the ships that travel the Morathomear sea, skimming along the surface. They use a store of water that keeps their hull, often wood or some other dead thing, from evaporating on the sea. They sink only a little into the sea only from the weight of dead or living souls pulled across with them. They most often propelled either by punts (basically oars) or more often by sail/kite. Winds from the fade above sink low enough to the sea that tall sails or kites can propel the ships over the glassy sea and then lower sails control the direction of travel as rudders are impossible.
The Living.

The living in Morathomear are few and incredibly outnumbered. They exclusively exist on the islands and ships of this plane as all other would result in them joining the dead. Morathomear has a predictable effect on people, on top of the Fade, it takes a steeled heart to live here as your instincts shout at you to run…
The Dead.

For the dead this is the last resting place before the last journey, a place where a half life can be had but at the very real danger of your soul. Here you are either greater or lesser as necromancy resonates with the plane around you and it warps all that you are…
The Lesser Dead.

The majority of souls are lesser dead, and while many choose to quickly descend beyond the rest stay in a half life. Maybe wandering the great sea, following the paths of ships or visiting the lands to try and regain what life they can.
The Anointed Dead.

These are similar to lesser souls but they are loved. Not by those in the living worlds but those living who reside in Morathomear. They are created by the ancient rituals passed from sailor to Vistani. They say this is a path to the reborn…
The Greater Dead.

They are the rarer class of dead, not only as the powerful are rare but as the powerful have a habit of falling to fast into the great sea and plunging into it’s depths. To deep to return before they even get a chance. They are closer to spirits than the living…

The Else. The else are the fiendish creations from the Elsewhere, they come from beneath the great sea and can swim through as great creatures, and if they are powerful enough they can drag themselves into life and take form on rocky shores, to travel deeper and higher into the planes…

The islands which are caused by conjunctions or the dead from the planes above and vary in material generally reflecting the plane or individual that caused them. Here souls may rest without the sea pulling them into it’s abyss. The draw remains though and few can stay for long without it getting the better of them, like draw of the sea to be smitten sailors.

You can find all manner of homesteads, ports, waystations and arcane towers hidden on these islands far from the prying eyes of spirits or mortals. Many have Mirrormear settlements above them as a more comfortable and somewhat less dangerous space for the living to rest.

Windrunners are the ships that travel the Morathomear sea, skimming along the surface. They use a store of water that keeps their hull, often wood or some other dead thing, from evaporating on the sea. They sink only a little into the sea only from the weight of dead or living souls pulled across with them. They most often propelled either by punts (basically oars) or more often by sail/kite. Winds from the fade above sink low enough to the sea that tall sails or kites can propel the ships over the glassy sea and then lower sails control the direction of travel as rudders are impossible.

Description

Arginoth is the resting realm and has been this way for 250 years. Before it’s slumber, the country was an imperial hub of arcane science and militaristic expansion. It developed warships feared around Kaleah, weapons of explosive power and had unparalleled expertise of the Mirrormear.
The Morphean Tragedy :
The effect of the sleeping is varied and seems to be somewhat reduced by Mountain and River however increased by population centres.
When entering the boundaries of effect, roll
for each mile travelled on the following table (also role for extreme actions of magic):
Roll 1d4 for either
blessed radiance
far realm
haunted
or
infested
tables.
Roll on the
Unraveling Magic Effects
table
Roll on the
Mirror Zone Effects
table
Roll on the
Psychic Resonance Effects
table
- 8. The party must make DC 12 Constitution save or fall asleep, only being able to be awaken once leaving the boundaries or by using a restoration/remove curse spell.

props.text: Smart militaristic suits with long ornate and regal cloaks. Common to wear jewelery.

content.text: A template for a specific location. For example, a bustling marketplace, a lonely shack in the countryside, a long-forgotten dungeon, or a derelict space station--Anywhere that a meaningful scene could take place.
Description
Avalthi is a port city much like Debrovnik. A large town surrounding a central citadel on a large raised rock.
It posses an massive mechanised naval barrier out in the bay that is rusted shut.
Origin
Why is this place here? What is its purpose? Is it naturally occurring or was it made? Why do people come here, if at all?
Routine
What does a normal day look like here?
Since the sleeping, a community of elves have come to the the citadel of Avalthi. They're are born by starlight and so can only enter Kaleah during the night.
They are a merry folk and need little excuse to throw great parties and events.
They often spend their nights travelling into
Arginoth
but will rarely travel further than can be made in a night.

Description
The expansive capital of Arginoth...

Description

This a neo-classical modern building built from a pale stone and glass. It is a built with three fold symmetry around a central core. It was originally just a mental asylum, but this was extended to a magical asylum for the mystically troubled.
